title: Please Help! I Cant play league on my new computer
body:
Hello, I just got a new computer from ASUS. It has windows 10 installed and evey time I try to open the launcher my computer crashes with a blue screen and an error that says "Unknown_Kernel_mode_trap" Here are my computer specs

GeForce GTX 960M
4GB VRA
16GB DDR4
1TB HDD
128GB SSD 
Intel Core i7-6700HQ 2.60 GHz

replies.body: Ok I fixed it, I installed all the updates for windows after I connected my laptop to the internet through an ethernet cable and Installed all my graphics drivers manually.
My Nvidia drivers are up to date and I just tried uninstalling then reinstalling league, I got to about 1% on the update and It started happening again.

A quick search of that error suggests it is the result of a bad or incorrect driver. Make sure Windows is fully updated, and manually update any non-Windows drivers you need to; if you're unable to update any, you can start your PC in 'Safe Mode' to do them.
Do you know how I could find out what drivers are giving me the problem? Its only with league that I get this error, All my other games work just fine.

Generally, a good place to start is by updating your drivers off of [Asus' Support site](https://www.asus.com/us/support/) with your laptop's model number.

You can grab the newest Nvidia Display Driver [here.](http://www.nvidia.com/download/driverResults.aspx/105039/en-us)

Let me know if this helped.
Try reinstalling the client and delete the old folder  and see if that works.
